title: Park Hill Apartments shooting was result of horseplay, cops say
content:
Gallery: View 9 Images
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. -- A 17-year-old boy was playing with a gun inside of a friend's apartment at the Park Hill Apartments in Clifton earlier this week when the weapon accidentally discharged and hit a girl in the room, police said.
The boy, identified by police as Isaac Kingue-Noah, fled after the incident and is being sought for questioning.
One woman who lives at 225 Park Hill Ave., where the incident occurred on Tuesday afternoon, said she saw a group of teens run out of the building screaming that one of them had been shot, but didn't know the victim, a 16-year-old girl.
The girl, who was shot in the right knee, was taken to Richmond University Medical Center, West Brighton, where she was listed in stable condition, cops said.
Kingue-Noah, who is described by police as a suspect in the shooting, stands 6 feet tall and weighs 170 pounds.
Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers hot line at 800-577-TIPS (8477); visit theCrime Stoppers website or text tips to CRIMES (274637) then enter TIP577.
